Title: Lead Data Science Instructor, Data Scientist at Galvanize Inc.
Description:
Galvanize is a dynamic learning community for technology. Our community is where people and companies with the guts and smarts to create real-world change congregate and inspire each other. Our goal is to make opportunities in technology available to all those with the aptitude, determination and drive. Across our beautifully designed urban campuses nationwide, we offer a unique combination of education, workspace and networking.

We are growing our data science instructional team at Galvanize. Our Instructors train technical professionals with programming experience to solve data science problems utilizing innovative educational techniques. We’re looking for passionate educators and practical problem solvers with demonstrated flexibility and curiosity.

Responsibilities: 
  • Deliver lectures and tutorials on: scientific Python, SQL, probability, statistics (Bayesian and frequentist), machine learning, and data engineering.
  • Lead day-long “sprints,” maintaining a strong presence in the classroom and helping other instructional staff
  • Deftly and patiently field student questions and provide feedback in lectures and office hours.
  • Build and refine data science curriculum and assignments.
  • Utilize student feedback and experimentation to continuously improve teaching and assessment methods
  • Evaluate new tools, packages, and tutorials for use in the curriculum.
  • Contribute to local evangelism, admissions, and nurture activities, such as attendance at meet-ups, speaking at conferences, leading workshops, etc. 

Professional Development: 
  • There’s no better way to learn than to teach! You’ll be amazed at how much you’ll develop skills you thought you were already an expert in just by helping students and planning lessons.
  • Opportunities to work with and learn from other data science and web development instructors in a highly collaborative and intellectually rich environment. 
  • Rub shoulders and cross-pollinate.
  • Keep your skills sharp with the option to work with our expert services arm, the Enterprise team, on industry web development and data science projects. Previous projects have involved: Machine Learning; Deep Learning, Data Engineering and Architecture, Applied Statistics and Statistical Modeling, Web Development Ruby on Rails, Angular, Ember, React, and Node.js and Express.
  • Become the best instructor you can be with ongoing training and support. 

Qualifications: 
  • Experience in industry in a data scientist or software engineer role.
  • Master's or PhD in a quantitative discipline such as engineering, statistics, or mathematics.
  • Strong understanding in the topics we teach: scientific Python, probability, statistics (Probability, A/B Testing, Bayesian methods, Regression methods, Time Series), SQL, machine learning (Decision Trees, Random Forest, Boosting, Support Vector Machines, Clustering, Natural Language Processing, Recommenders, Graphs), data engineering (Hadoop, Hive, and MapReduce), data visualization (d3), and data at scale. For more details on the program go to: http://www.galvanize.com/courses/data-science/#.Viqz4LQR8UU.
  • Outstanding communication skills.
  • Experience teaching a quantitative subject preferred.

Galvanize provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Sr. Data Scientist at Adobe Json
Description:
The Role

We are looking for a Sr. Data Scientist - Product Analytics to join the Adobe Fonts team as we embark on the exciting journey to deliver one of the largest and most critical Creative Cloud services! In this role, you will develop and maintain a modern data architecture to further our reporting, analytics, experimentation capabilities, and inputs into our business and royalty models. On a longer term you will use predictive modeling and machine learning to help the team understand, lead, and optimize the entire customer experience with fonts throughout the customer journey. . Ideal candidates will have a strong academic background as well as technical skills such as applied statistics and data engineering. The team prides itself on being customer focused, agile, and data driven. If you are looking for a chance to be a part of an industry groundbreaking opportunity, this one is for you!

What You'll Do :

  • Partner with product managers and software engineers to define data and product instrumentation requirements, and build the necessary tooling required to ensure timely delivery of high-quality data
  • Partner with business teams to help manage, analyze and present font usage and royalty data define and produce data necessary for defining the business model for font use royalties. ​
  • Build and maintain various product and engineering dashboards to inform the team about the state of the business, as well as to alert partners when issues occur
  • Optimize scheduled jobs and explore new solutions to increase operational efficiency
  • Develop predictive models to address various business problems by using statistical modeling or machine learning
  • Collaborate with product management and engineering groups to develop new products and features

What You'll Need to Succeed :

  • MS degree in Statistics, Applied Math, Computer Science or other related fields
  • 5+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist preferable in a large environment
  • Proficient in SQL and experience in Python, R
  • Experience in product instrumentation is a plus
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau is a plus
  • Strong understanding of statistical modeling and machine learning concepts.
  • Proven business insight, previous experience with product analytics
  • Possess natural curiosity, creativity, and technical acumen, being capable of asking critical questions about data and always ready to tackle any challenges
  • Excellent communication, relationship skills, and a strong teammate

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.

If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Title: Associate Data Scientist at Walt Disney Company
Description:
The Walt Disney Company is a world-class entertainment and technology leader. Walt’s passion was to continuously envision new ways to move audiences around the world—a passion that remains our touchstone in an enterprise that stretches from: animation, theme parks, resorts and a cruise line to sports, news, movies and a variety of other businesses. Uniting each endeavor is a commitment to creating and delivering unforgettable experiences — and we’re constantly looking for new ways to enhance these exciting experiences. Part of the Walt Disney Television Group, Disney Television Animation (DTVA) is a high-volume digital animation production studio. Because of DTVA’s strong use of commercial and custom software technologies to create its animation products, its use of technology, engineering, development techniques and software are critical to its production operations and workflows. Disney Television Animation Technology (DTVAT) innovates and delivers solutions that support our animation studio whose content is legendary and transcends generations. As part of the Technology team you’ll be joining a group of passionate, dedicated technologists solving a range of interesting problems in innovative ways in an exciting and dynamic industry. We are looking for high-performing, motivated individuals who are generalists and proficient in many technologies and languages. Our team embraces disruptive thinkers who can drive innovation.


We’re looking for an intellectually curious, business-savvy, analytical powerhouse to join the Disney Television Animation Technology team as an Associate Data Scientist. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, building and channeling data visualization solutions across the various Disney Television Animation business departments. You will be working through industry research, participate in ongoing education, and apply practical experience while working along the path of becoming a leading subject matter expert in digital workflow and user behavior via data analyst.


+ Minimum 1 year of work experience in media, advertising, or digital products driving measurable results is highly preferred.

+ Excellent understanding of statistics and the ability to confidently translate statistical analyses into compelling and actionable recommendations.

+ Strong experience with Excel and writing SQL to extract and manipulate data at the source

+ Experience with any of the following tools is a plus:

+ Spark, Hive / Hadoop

+ Cloud data platforms

+ D3.js

+ MATLAB

+ Excel

+ R and ggplot2

+ Tableau

+ Jupyter

+ Matplotlib

+ NLTK

+ Scikit-learn

+ TensorFlow

+ Weka

+ Experience with consumer behavior and insights analysis (transactional and usage).

+ Self-motivated with the ability to work independently.

+ Great written and verbal communication and teamwork skills.

+ Proven ability in predictive analytics and modeling.

+ Knowledge or background in data engineering is a plus.

+ Required Education: Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent work experience


Supporting the Disney Television Animation business, the Associate Data Scientist should be well versed in each of the following areas:


+ Work closely with DTVA Technology department management to provide requirements, offer input, and track progress on infrastructure and engineering work streams that are relevant to the business.

+ Working collaboratively with cross-functional teams consisting of: Executives, Software Developers, System Engineers, System Administrators and Site Reliability Engineers to create strategies around Knowledge Discovery / Data Mining.

+ Apply statistical and modeling skills to enhance the understanding of our application and workflow data.

+ Conduct hands-on research, business intelligence analysis and data mining on large, complex data sets to support the business.

+ Collaborate and Ideate on building predictive models and algorithms to optimize software tools and data visualization solutions.

+ Create and optimize data visualization models that enable us to target specific: business, financial, operational and technology needs.

+ Analyzing the performance of applications, systems, processes in order to provide data and feedback tied to optimizations and refinements.

+ Examining other ways to expand the use of data science for improved decision support.

+ Help improve business decision support solutions by leveraging internal and external datasets.

+ Contribute in technical discussions on data standards and tooling.


Company Overview :

English


Job ID: 733776BR

Location: Glendale,California

Job Posting Company: Media Networks
The Walt Disney Company and its Affiliated Companies are Equal Employment Opportunity employers and welcome all job seekers including individuals with disabilities and veterans with disabilities. If you have a disability and believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or apply for a position, email Candidate.Accommodations@Disney.com with your request. This email address is not for general employment inquiries or correspondence. We will only respond to those requests that are related to the accessibility of the online application system due to a disability.

Title: Data Scientist, Trusted Identity at Square
Description:
Company Description

Square builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Square started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Square made credit card payments possible for all by turning a mobile phone into a credit card reader. Since then Square has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Capital, Square Terminal, Square Payroll, and more. Were working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own termsand were looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square.

Job Description

As a Data Scientist within the Trusted Identity team at Square, you lead projects that find value from our unique, rich, and expanding data.Specifically, you lead the development of algorithms to help us understand who our sellers are and whether they are using Squares services within the law.

Squares mission is to make commerce more accessible to all. Trusted Identitys mission is to build a data-driven approach to quantifying trust in our sellers. This approach gives Square the ability to accept as broad a group of sellers as possible onto our platform, including sellers that other payments processors may not accept, such as the underbanked, or sellers running nontraditional businesses. Trusted Identity sits at the top of the seller funnel, meaning that our works impact percolates through every element of the Square ecosystem.We use our concept of quantified trust to support offering Square to as many sellers as possible while also keeping Square safe from financial crimes, such as money laundering. You lead the development of data solutions that ensure that Trusted Identity can continue to fulfill our mission efficiently and effectively as Square continues to scale.

You will:

  • Guide analytics projects from beginning to end: work with partner teams, frame and structure questions, collect and analyze data, and present key insights to support decision-making
  • Partner with Squares Compliance team to identify, prioritize, and solve problems where analytics and data science will have a significant impact - with a focus on aiding in Squares compliance with the US Bank Secrecy Act and Anti-Money Laundering laws
  • Work with engineers to promote data best practices and implement analytics solutions
  • Work with business leaders, subject matter experts, and decision makers to develop success criteria and improve new products, features, policies, and models
  • Use your experience in analytics tools and scientific thoughtfulness to produce actionable insights
  • Use machine learning to improve our ability to address Trusted Identity, Compliance, and general operational concerns
  • Communicate results to senior management in verbal, visual, and written media
  • Help build the next generation of data products at Square
Qualifications

You have:

  • An advanced degree (M.S., PhD.), preferably in Statistics, Computer Science, Physical Sciences, Economics, or a related technical field
  • A strong track record of performing data analysis using Python (numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, etc.) and SQL
  • Familiarity with Linux/OS X command line, version control software (git), and general software development
  • Experience using statistics and machine learning to solve complex problems
  • Experience developing and deploying machine learning / deep learning solutions in production
  • The ability to communicate complex results to all audiences
  • 1 years industry experience in data science or machine learning-focused roles

Technologies we use and teach:

  • Python (numpy, pandas, sklearn) & R
  • SQL
  • Machine Learning (e.g. regression, ensemble methods, neural networks)
  • Statistics (Bayesian methods, experimental design, causal inference)
  • Looker
  • Google Cloud Platform


Additional Information

Square Perks

At Square, we want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes:

  • Healthcare coverage
  • Retirement Plans
  • Employee Stock Purchase Program
  • Meal reimbursements
  • Wellness perks
  • Paid parental leave
  • Flexible time off
  • Learning and Development resources

At Square, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)squareup.com. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.

Title: IT - Data Scientist at Mindlance
Description:
RP (11697)
IT - Data Scientist

• Applies machine learning and other analytical modeling methods to develop robust and reliable analytical models, including visualizations, within PG&E's software development environment. • Gathers, cleans, transforms, and/or reduces data from dissimilar sources from across PG&E. • Collaborates with team members and stakeholders to effectively manage the lifecycle of a model, retraining, replacing or sunsetting models when appropriate. • Shares and collaborates with other PG&E data scientists. • Delivers best-in-class software as part of a software delivery team.

Quals--
Minimum Education/Skills: • Bachelor's Degree in Econometrics, Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, Applied Sciences, Statistics or job-related discipline or equivalent experience • Job-related experience, 5 years, OR Master's Degree and job-related experience, 3 years, OR Doctorate Desired Education / Skills: • Experience with the data science lifecycle, including data engineering, feature engineering, model building and evaluation, model deployment. • Knowledge of commonly used data science programming languages, packages, and tools, especially Python. • Understanding of data science/machine learning models and algorithms, not limited to: deep learning (CNN, RNN etc), decision trees (e.g. xgboost, random forest), unsupervised techniques (e.g. clustering, anomaly detection), natural language processing and statistical methods. • Experience training models in a public cloud environment, using tools such as Jupyter, AWS Sagemaker. • Ability to synthesize complex information into clear insights and translate those insights into decisions and actions. • Ability to clearly communicate complex technical details and insights to colleagues and stakeholders. • Knowledge of the mathematical and statistical fields that underpin data science • Knowledge of systems thinking and decomposition of complex problems. • Humble – is open to being coached, has high EQ and is self-aware • Hungry – desires to get things done while honoring people, and seeks better ways to do the job • Collaborative – has strong interpersonal skills; cares about and works well with teammates • Experience working on an agile delivery team, using methods such as Scrum, Kanban.

Title: Data Scientist at Telaria
Description:
What We’re About

Telaria (NYSE: TLRA), (formerly Tremor Video), is the leading independent data-driven software platform built to monetize and manage premium video inventory with the greatest speed, control, and transparency, wherever and however audiences are watching.

We are looking to leverage our vast amounts of advertising data to make informed decisions around business optimizations and efficiencies. We are a small and efficient team building out a solution in an exciting space with lots of green field ahead of it. Believing we’re just scratching the surface of the power of our data, we’re actively searching for passionate and analytical data scientists to help us extract actionable insights in order to improve our product offerings.

Why You’ll Be Excited

  • Having a large stake and impact on the product and business direction and bottom-line
  • Collaborating with innovative and goal-focused engineering and business teams
  • Applying statistics, modeling and ML to improve the efficiency of systems relating to bid traffic shaping and infrastructure costs
  • Diving into a wide range of advertising business topics, such as forecasting, revenue yield, auction dynamics, and exchange optimization
  • Influencing and steering the improvement and development of our data platforms, data pipelines, and data science processes
  • Performing deep dive analyses to understand and optimize the key levers of our growth

Why We’ll Be Excited About You

  • You have strong verbal and written communication skills that help you express your work in meaningful ways to cross functional teams
  • You are passionate about digging into data sets
  • You are able to write efficient and well-structured SQL queries on large data sets
  • You have a solid background and understanding of statistical analysis, experimental design, and machine learning aspects (regression, classification, clustering, supervised/unsupervised, etc.)
  • You have experience with data extraction, exploration, and analysis using programming languages (Java, Python, R, or similar) and data technologies (Spark, etc.)
  • You have a degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or another applicable quantitative field
  • You have familiarity with concepts relating to feature extraction and selection
  • Bonus: You have previous advertising domain knowledge/expertise

Why We (and You’ll) Love It Here

  • We are a technology and data-driven business
  • We embrace analytical thinking, kind, and results driven people
  • We have a plethora of challenging and interesting problems to solve
  • We help and support each other in creating a productive work/life balance

Compensation & Benefits:

At Telaria we place an emphasis and importance on ensuring our total rewards are competitive, aligned with industry and to help you create a productive work/life balance. Benefits are highly subsidized and include medical, company paid dental, vision, employer contributed Health Savings Account, 401k matching, corporate gym discounts, pre-tax health and commuter savings, life insurance, 5 and 10-year Sabbatical programs, Discretionary Time Off (a.k.a. open vacation policy!), Paid Parental Leave, an Employee Referral Program, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), and much more! All this is within a collaborative work environment you can personalize and topped with engaging programs like Micro-Mentorship, and Team Sports.

Telaria values diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Data Scientist at HP
Description:
Data Scientist

As Data Scientist at HP Inc. in San Diego, you will join an industry-leading organization and work on developing frameworks for systematic data science modeling to identify optimal marketing, pricing and sales decisions for our Printing & PC business. Working within a dynamic, highly skilled and diverse Pricing Strategy and Analytics team (economists, engineers, scientists or even musicians ? majority of them with a PhD) you will build models and develop tools and analytical processes to develop pricing and marketing strategies for HP printers, cartridges and PCs around the world.

Responsibilities:
  • Develop and apply statistical methods to analyze the effect of pricing and sales decisions on business performance
  • Develop and implement frameworks and processes for systematic and automated data analysis
  • Develop tools to ingest, merge, and clean data sets
  • Immerse yourself in very large data sets and complex problems
  • Visualize and interpret the results of analyses, and create strategy recommendations
  • Present the results and the corresponding recommendations to the relevant stakeholders, including senior leadership


Qualifications:
  • Interest in data science, pricing, economics, and/or consumer behavior
  • Scientific thinking and ability to design and critically analyze quantitative research
  • Ability to think creatively about research problems and invent original solutions to modeling challenges
  • Ability to build and interpret complex linear regression models, with machine learning experience a plus
  • Knowledge of and experience in deploying numerical optimization routines
  • Proficiency with Python and R is required
  • Strong analytical skills, with a high level of attention to detail
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPoint
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills


Nice-To-Haves:
  • Knowledge of price optimization approaches, price discrimination models and a general knowledge of main concepts from the industrial organization literature
  • Experience working with large data sets
  • Experience in data engineering
  • Exposure to digital marketing
  • Experience working in or collaborating with industry
  • Experience creating data visualizations
  • Ability to build dashboards and other tools using front-end development skills
  • Experience in software development


Education & Experience
  • Bachelor?s, Master's or PhD degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Quantitative Marketing, Mathematics, Physics or equivalent
  • 1-3 years? experience including graduate or postgraduate research

Title: Data Scientist at LaBine & Associates
Description:
We’re looking for an exceptional data scientist to join the team responsible for expanding the core technology behind our suite of optimization algorithms. Our team is made up of a small group of engineers and researchers who are passionate about creating innovative solutions built with modern technology. As one of the earliest members of this team, your talent and expertise will have the opportunity to influence nearly all aspects of the business, including pricing and sales, sourcing, targeted marketing, and the technologies that we use to determine the most efficient way to aggregate our customers’ shipments.

Responsibilities:

  • Take ownership of key components of our analytics and optimization platform
  • Design, prototype, develop, and maintain, and tune new and existing algorithms to model and predict a priori freight pooling outcomes
  • Write high-quality, well-documented, benchmarking tools to evaluate solution quality, and inform business and engineering decisions
  • Identify, quantify, and prioritize new opportunities for data science techniques to quickly deliver significant business value
  • Work both independently and in a highly collaborative environment with other researchers and software engineers to refine and operationalize new ideas

Requirements:

Advanced degree in Math, Computer Science, Physics, or Operations Research. At least one of the following is required:

  • Masters with at least two years of experience working on relevant data science problems
  • PhD

Skills and Experience:

  • Experience with data mining and statistical modeling techniques such as clustering, classification, regression, tree-based methods, neural nets, and anomaly detection.
  • Familiarity with relevant, modern data science tools, libraries, and frameworks
  • Practical or research application of object-oriented, functional, and concurrent programming
  • Exceptional problem solving, analysis, decomposition, and communication skills
  • Proficient with Java, R, or Python
  • Git, modern IDEs and build/deployment tools (Optional)
  • Experience authoring / working on production grade systems (Optional)
experience (data mining, statistical modeling techniques such as clustering, classification, regression, tree based methods, neural nets, and anomaly detection)

Title: Data Scientist,  People Analytics at Workday
Description:
Join our team and experience Workday!

It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At Workday, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to have a good time, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is fun.

Job Description

Senior People Analytics Analyst

If your professional passion is creating a high-performance work environment by pioneering innovative people analytics and insights --then we should talk. We are looking for a results-oriented professional ready to channel their experiences into the challenge of creating pioneering solutions that deliver breakthrough business results.

As the Senior People Analytics Analyst on Workday’s People Analytics & Insights team, you will work closely with the various People & Purpose Centers of Excellence to help build analytical insights that our business leaders need to help scale and grow Workday. This key team member will need to influence internal and external stakeholders and use data to impact key strategic business decisions.

This role will deliver results in these mission-critical areas:

Analyze complex business problems using data from internal and external sources to Provide insights to decision-makers

You will be responsible for helping to solve complex problems faced by our leadership and management by providing scalable analytics and insights of our people and people practices.

  • Identify and interpret trends and patterns in datasets. Provide recommendations based on business data, people data, and organizational knowledge.
  • Create specifications for analysis based on business needs and required or available data elements.
  • May provide consultation to users and lead cross-functional teams to address business issues.

Develop analytics, tools, and insights that drive Improved Decision Making about our People, Culture, and Leadership

You will help enable our people strategies through high quality, compelling analytics that arm our Leaders with the insights they need to scale our business and ensure that Workday is a great place to work for all.

  • Develop and execute insights that inform decision making around our people, culture, and leadership.
  • Build and execute an autonomous insights mechanism whereby People Leaders and Executives receive analytical insights and strategic nudges derived from their data, personalized to their context, and delivered via Workday.
  • Generate new and innovative analytics and insights based on business needs, audience feedback, cutting-edge neuroscience, behavioral economics, network, leadership, and management research.

Explore, Test, and Validate New Advanced Analytics Approaches

You will design and execute new analytical methodologies in service of our people and talent strategies.

  • Provide applications and interpretations of advanced analytic methodologies and processes designed to provide insights to our business leaders to improve decision making an ultimately drive growth.
  • Identify patterns and insights from rich transactions (structured and unstructured) and people data to help optimize decision making, including building predictive models that inform this process.
  • Conduct research studies to solve key people business issues. Implement research findings in Workday technology through analytical apps, PRISM, and campaigns.

Qualities Required for Success

We believe the person for this role will possess interests and experiences in the following areas:

Problem Solving:

Uses rigorous logic and methods to solve difficult problems

  • Probes sources for answers and can see hidden problems beyond what is obvious
  • Is excellent at honest analysis and clear about the results to be achieved through the analysis and looks beyond the obvious and doesn’t stop at the first answers

Collaboration:
Cultivates and leverages productive collaborative relationships to deliver results

  • Creates constructive and candid dialogue and influences others without using formal authority
  • Thoughtfully challenges the status quo

Innovation

Creates new ideas and associations that generate new value

  • Thinks independently and comes up with novel solutions, analytics, and programs that add value and demonstrates high tolerance for ambiguity as ideas are being formulated
  • Builds support for new ways through the personal excitement they exhibit and is willing to take risks and persists in the face of crisis and failure; hard to discourage

Results-Oriented
Delivers committed results in a fast-paced, high-growth environment

  • Is focused, disciplined, and self-directed in addressing opportunities that deliver results and acts with a sense of urgency, embracing high-value stretch over safe goals
  • Holds oneself accountable for contribution goals, not being thwarted by challenges and setbacks and consistently delivers successfully at scale, globally

Communication
Designs and delivers skillful messaging and storytelling to effectively reach people and influence behavior

  • Ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders and crafts messaging and framing that resonates and organizes it with thoughtfulness to maximize buy-in and impact
  • Assesses audience’s current needs and targets communication for effectiveness and demonstrates knowledge of analytics and its application to behavioral change and leadership decision making

Required Experience

  • Master’s degree preferred, specifically related to Computational Social Sciences, Management Sciences, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics or related fields.
  • 3+ years of experience in Data Science, Talent Analytics, Survey Design and Analysis, People Analytics or related fields (statistics, economics, network science).
  • Prior use of business intelligence and analytics tools required, data visualization tools, data manipulation tools, integration tools (APIs) and data storage tools preferred.
  • Knowledge of scripting and query languages (Python, R, SQL)
  • Workday experience a plus, especially PRISM Analytics

Workday is proud of its diverse workforce, but does not sponsor employment visas or consider individuals on time-limited visas that will require sponsorship now or in the future for these positions.

#LI-SB3

Title: IT Vendor Manager at Applicantz Inc
Description:
Managing vendors for the existing team, which is responsible for building a Client's Cloud Platform. The client's VMO manages several Cloud-native vendors across domains such as API Management, Security, Identity & Authentication, Database Providers, SAAS/PAAS providers, service and staff augmentation providers.

The Vendor Manager is responsible for managing vendor relationships including contracts, performance, relationship, risk and financials

  • Support specific areas of the business and manage all their vendor accounts.
  • Manages vendor management policies and procedures
  • Manage the entire lifecycle of a vendor engagement from sourcing, onboarding, execution to offboarding
  • Work with Business, Procurement and Security teams on RF(x) processes, technical vendor evaluations, security assessments and so on
  • Work with Business, Procurement, Legal teams to ensure contracts have appropriate verbiage for terms and conditions, service level agreements, key performance indicators, escalation processes
  • Responsible for contract management including compliance, oversight, and adherence to change control procedures. Monitor and ensure contract renewals are planned and executed well in advance of the expiry
  • Responsible for performance management, including performance analysis and SLA/KPI monitoring.
  • Set up regular check-ins with vendor account managers, facilitate regular conversations between the business and vendor operations teams
  • Plan and conduct regular business reviews and executive meetings at a cadence agreed with the business
  • Monitor vendor performance, risk, financial data on an on-going basis and report to stakeholders as agreed. Initiate and execute performance improvement initiatives and go to green plans as necessary
  • Participates in issue/risk management and review risk/issue analysis reports
  • Work with the Data Science team to ensure all relevant vendor data is automated and available on dashboards
  • Support the business in demand planning and during execution, monitor how we are tracking against the original plan. Flag overages and additional budget asks well in advance
  • Work on offboarding the vendor from systems as well as on contract termination
  • Provide effective and efficient solutions to complex business problems.
  • Provide high-level oversight and leadership.

 SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITIES (SKA) REQUIRED:

 2-4 years' of experience

  • Excellent analytical, organizational, planning, verbal, and written communication skills.
  • Other related skills and/or abilities may be required to perform this job.
  • Ability to read and interpret documents such as contracts, terms, and conditions, non-disclosure agreements.
  • Ability to work with and empower others on a collaborative basis to ensure the success of VMO.
  • Ability to establish workflows, manage multiple projects, and meet necessary deadlines.
  • Must have experience working with Cloud-native vendors
  • MS Office

Title: Sr. Marketing Manager 1 [c] at Genesis10
Description:
Genesis10 is currently seeking a Sr. Marketing Manager 1 [c] with our client in their San Francisco, CA location. This is a 8 month + contract position.

Description:
  • Seeking a Sr. Marketing Manager 1 [c]
Responsibilities:
  • Create multi-channel media strategy to grow job seeker user base and drive product adoption
  • Own consumer acquisition marketing campaigns at every stage of the funnel, driving awareness, engagement, conversion and winback
  • Leverage segmentation and data insights to deploy targeted, channel-specific marketing tactics across SEM, Display, Paid Social, Video, Audio and offline channels
  • Test and optimize acquisition flows to create a seamless member journey that thoughtfully connects marketing and product touchpoints
  • Partner with data scientists and business operations to design and execute a rigorous A/B testing agenda to understand and enhance marketing effectiveness
  • Effectively measure, analyze and optimize marketing programs across job seeker lifecycle

  • Desired Skills:
    • Experience in consumer internet product marketing; Proven track record of developing and executing high impact marketing strategies

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist from Johnson Service Group
Description:
Johnson Service Group is seeking a Sr. Business Analyst with strong Analytics and Tableau experience. This is direct hire opportunity with a great company in the SouthBay. They are seeking Business Intelligence or Analytics space and Data Science experience.

 

•         Advanced SQL / skills with large-scale, complex data sets.

•         Advanced Tableau required.

 

Job Duties:

  • Analyze Client products and business initiatives and translate results from data into actionable insights that help drive business goals and improve company performance.
  • Interact with senior executives and other analysts across various teams in the organization and deliver data analytics solutions.
  • Develop and automate analytical reports & visualization for various business units and stakeholders throughout the organization utilizing AWS, Hadoop, OBIEE and Tableau to enable educated decision making.
  • Monitor and analyze key metrics and execute recurring analyses and reporting.
  • Manage the clickstream tracking of data using tools such as Adobe Analytics and Tealium to ensure we are capturing the necessary data to evaluate the business.
  • Work with partners to acquire, store, and report on third party data ensuring functional, performance, and quality requirements are met.
  • Work hand in hand with the Product team in understanding the data & analytics needs of the company
  • Work closely with engineering team to get appropriate date to build analytics
  • Architect reporting and analytics platform that fits Client’s needs.
  • Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data & implement Machine Learning & predictive analytics to drive business goals.
  • Ability to multi task with data initiatives including new data acquisition, new metric calculations, machine learning models, etc.
  • Administration of reporting, analytics and web analytics tools
  • Provide hands on support to resolve production issues
  • Communicate with internal stakeholders regarding new releases, production issue status, etc.

Requirements:

 

  • BA / BS degree in related field.
  • 8+ years of experience in data warehouse / data lake/ Business Intelligence or Analytics space and Data Science experience.
  • Advanced SQL / query language skills with large-scale, complex data sets.
  • Ability to analyze large data sets, manipulate data, and make data driven recommendations.
  • Experience with administration of Tableau and OBIEE servers and report users
  • Ability to tell a story to executives based on the data
  • Highly familiar with database, data warehouse and ETL concepts, with the ability to translate between business users and engineers.
  • Experience managing various tagging and tracking platforms such as Adobe Marketing Cloud (Omniture), Tealium, Google Analytics, etc.
  • Experience with the following technologies is desired: Hadoop, AWS, Tableau, Looker or other OLAP cube/data visualization, Oracle database, Adobe Marketing Cloud (Omniture), Google Analytics, Clicktale, ExactTarget/Salesforce (or similar ESP)
  • Experience coordinating and communicating with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Strong understanding of E-Commerce and online sales attribution methodologies. Experience with MLM business is a plus
  • Excellent organizational, technical writing, oral and interpersonal communication skills, and keen attention to detail.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong Ability to prioritize and handle multiple initiatives / tasks in parallel as well as changing priorities

Title: Data Scientist / Data Manager at Kelly Services (US)
Description:
BioInformatics/Data Scientist / Data Manager– La Jolla, CA

 

Open ended contract position with Kelly OCG (Outsource Consulting Group). You will receive full benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid vacation, Holidays, sick time, and 401k, etc.

 

Client: Johnson and Johnson/ Janssen

 

Rate: up to $125k based on experience

 

JOB DESCRIPTION:
 

  • Discovery Sciences (DS) is a global organization that enables small molecule discovery for Janssen R&D, including functions such as medicinal chemistry, assay development, high throughput screening, compound profiling and computational sciences. The Data Operations team in DS Operations safeguards the research end-to-end data flows in order to enable timely decision making and enhance the value of the data. The team is doing this by guiding the scientists through the data applications and the data processes and by partnering with R&D-IT to optimize the data landscape, using a global, cross-functional mindset.
    To enable cross-functional alignment, facilitate onboarding of new users and improve standardization and compliance with internal guidelines, we are looking for someone to provide on-site support and training for key data systems. This will involve working with scientists to understand their process and provide training aligned with their workflow.
    Additionally, to optimize the data flow and enable timely, data-driven decision making, we are looking for someone to create and support project data visualizations. Tools are in place to accomplish this but require time and expertise to create and maintain. Special attention will be paid to harmonize visualization practices with other sites.
    We are looking for an enthusiastic, customer-oriented IT-savvy scientist or an IT professional with a scientific background to implement these projects and to support the scientists on additional data flow related topics in their daily work.
    KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
    Include, but not limited to:
    • On-site trainer for key applications including Genedata Screener and Biovia-ELN.
    • Collaborate with IT to troubleshoot and resolve user issues with these applications.
    • Data capture: collaborate with the scientists to upload all data in the discovery data warehouse, include metadata, understand the requirements of data scientists, enable re-usability of data outside the context of the original project
    • Become an expert in data warehouse in- and outflow, assist users with data flow related questions, partner with R&D IT to troubleshoot and resolve issues
    • Assist chemists in data collection/storage and visualization for their project data sets

    QUALIFICATIONS
    • A minimum of a Bachelors degree and Master's is highly preferred.
    •1-3  years of relevant industry experience.  Drug discovery is highly preferred.
    • Experience in working at the interface between systems and business, is preferred.
    • Working knowledge of data integration and warehousing is preferred.
    • Familiarity with large datasets, understanding of data processing and analysis workflows, and/or knowledge of querying languages such as SQL is preferred.
    • Understanding of master data management principles and processes is preferred.
    • Experience in data handling in external collaborations is preferred.
    • Experience with the Janssen discovery data warehouse (ABCD) and related tools (3DX, IVR) is preferred.
    • Experience with Genedata Screener or other dose response fitting software is preferred.
    • Experience with Biovia-ELN or other Electronic Lab Notebook software is preferred.
    • Strong networking and relationship building skills, team player
    • Ability to independently plan, organize, coordinate, lead and execute assigned tasks
    • Insight-driven to actively uncover critical unmet needs and turn them into new opportunities
    • Challenges the status quo, and leads and adapts to change
    • Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
    • Big picture oriented with attention to details
    • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


Why Kelly®?

As a worker today, it’s up to you to take charge of your career and look for opportunities to learn, grow, and achieve your potential. Helping you find what’s next is what we’re all about. We know what’s going on in the evolving world of work—just ask the nearly 500,000 people we employ each year. Connecting with us means getting the support, guidance, and opportunities needed to take your career where you may have never imagined.

About Kelly®

At Kelly, we’re always thinking about what’s next and advising job seekers on new ways of working to reach their full potential. In fact, we’re a leading advocate for temporary/nontraditional workstyles, because we believe they allow flexibility and tremendous growth opportunities that enable a better way to work and live. Connecting great people with great companies is what we do best, and our employment opportunities span a wide variety of workstyles, skill levels, and industries around the world.

Kelly is an equal opportunity employer committed to employing a diverse workforce, including, but not limited to, minorities, females, individuals with disabilities, protected veterans, sexual orientation, gender identity. Equal Employment Opportunity is The Law.

Title: Senior Loyalty Strategist from PK Global
Description:
Overview

PK, the Experience Engineering firm, helps the world’s most customer-obsessed brands design, build and run the future.  At PK, we blend great design and strong tech to accelerate outcomes.  We take a human-centered approach to creating moments that matter for our clients and their customers.  

 

If you bring craftmanship and passion to your work, we invite you to learn more about the firm that creates amazing experiences, apps, software and platforms – and have fun doing it.

 

PK is the premier firm helping companies develop innovative and disruptive customer experiences. We work across the customer lifecycle to build stronger customer connections. Our global footprint enables us to scale solutions across strategy, experience design, prototyping, and development using cutting-edge technology to deliver high-value experiences. A career at PK means you have the opportunity to provide insight, guidance, and winning strategies to Fortune 100 clients while building your personal brand as a thought leader.

 

One of PK’s core areas of specialization is customer loyalty, helping B2C and B2B companies develop and execute strategies that enhance value for their customers and improve retention. This is an exciting, growing, and strategically important part of the overarching business, and we are seeking experienced subject matter experts who can help us grow, scale, and continue to innovate in this space.

 

The Senior Loyalty Strategist will oversee development and delivery of innovative customer loyalty solutions, working with top tier clients across industries to drive their transformation roadmap. The role will work as part of multi-disciplinary teams to support client objectives and accomplish shared project goals. Successful candidates will have demonstrated experience leading consulting teams, a track record serving as a strategic thought leader, and a personal commitment to doing exceptional work.

Responsibilities

  • Serve as the senior customer loyalty expert on client engagements, providing perspective and overseeing project delivery
  • Provide leadership spanning various customer-focused marketing & CX disciplines: customer strategy, loyalty program design, digital marketing programs, personalization, CRM, and CX initiatives
  • Develop and apply methodology, frameworks, and other assets to client engagements
  • Ensure robust, high-value solutions are designed by effectively integrating industry best-practices, customer research, data analytics, and a client’s brand / corporate strategy
  • Develop credibility, trust, and rapport with C-level client executives
  • Coach, mentor, and develop team members
  • Contribute thought leadership to development of IP, public speaking engagements, and internal practice development efforts
  • Partner with colleagues to pursue new business, grow accounts, and contribute to the sales process
  • Spend roughly 80% of time on client delivery, 20% on internal practice development and leadership

Qualifications

  • Demonstrated ability to articulate a compelling perspective on customer loyalty
  • 10+ years working in customer-focused functional areas: marketing, CX, digital products, etc.
  • Industry experience in a mix of industries, preferably including: Retail, Healthcare, Telecom, Media, Entertainment, and Technology
  • 4+ years in professional services, preferably a leadership or managerial role
  • Working familiarity with martech platforms and associated customer data sets
  • Fluency with customer analytics / data sciences, primary and secondary research methods, financial analysis, and strategy / solution development
  • Executive level storytelling, visioning, and presentation skills
  • Experience in a client-facing consulting role creating strategy deliverables for a consulting firm or agency
  • Fluency in leading multiple projects and teams, including creation of project plans, project scoping, proposal development, stakeholder interviews, meeting facilitation, and presentation
  • Well-honed written, verbal, and interpersonal skills employed discerningly dependent on the setting, stakeholders, and timing—your ability to listen first is essential in how you craft a compelling story
  • Proficiency in data and communication tools (e.g. Excel, PowerPoint); working knowledge of analytics and research processes
  • Direct experience creating new business

PK is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetics, disability, age, marriage status, pregnancy status, political affiliation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Foster City, CA

Full Stack Developer / Machine Learning Engineer

Full Stack Engineers
  • Looking for a candidate, who has a passion for building scalable applications, solving problems, working with business stakeholders.

  • has strong interpersonal skills; cares about and works well with teammates

Title: Sr. Business Analyst at USDM Life Sciences
Description:
USDM Life Sciences Overview

USDM Life Sciences provides a variety of IT and compliance solutions to help life sciences companies streamline laboratory, clinical and manufacturing operations while staying in compliance with FDA regulations. USDM disrupts convention and delivers compliance with proficiency, simplicity, and efficiency to achieve better results for our customers that are in the business of saving lives. It’s a place where you can make an impact in the world as a champion for life sciences innovation and also get the experience and mentoring to grow your career.

Founded in Santa Barbara, California in 1999 by two UCSB graduates, USDM has grown to a global company with offices throughout the US, Toronto, Canada and Frankfurt, Germany.

The Sr Business Analyst will be responsible for supporting PDM (Pharmaceutical Development and Manufacturing) department’s greater use of data in reporting, analytics, visualizations, and obtaining insights. They will be responsible for helping a team of data scientists, developers and analysts develop analytic tools and apply data sciences techniques to continue to improve our knowledge management, perform predictive analytics, and identify trends in scientific and operational datasets. Furthermore, they will drive artificial intelligence and machine learning projects throughout PDM to uncover patterns, correlations, and new insights in data that would otherwise be difficult to do due to large data volumes and data in various systems with different data models and structures.
 
Qualifications/Required Skills
•    Ability to interact with the business and technical teams to gather requirements, finalize and obtain sign-off from the stakeholders and support the technical teams during the entire lifecycle of the project
•    Ensure all application functionalities designed are implemented and delivered within the timelines
•    Track and manage progress of work, manage escalations and ensure the delivery of Business process management and application
•    Expertise crafting use cases, user stories, requirements and design specifications using agile methodology
•    Experience working with a development team to create dashboards in visualizations tools like Tableau, Spotfire, R Shiny, Django, Qlickview etc.
•    Strong awareness and market knowledge of Advanced Analytics & Data Science
•    Ability to produce reports and track progress of the team and other reporting needs on the project
 
Qualifications
 
•    Bachelor’s degree in Biology, Business, Information Systems or related field
•    Overall 10+ years’ experience in Pharmaceutical Supply Chain

The end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.

A Hospitality Company is seeking a Security Specialist in Burbank, CA

Role Description
* Responsible for designing, building and channeling data visualization solutions across the enterprise.
* You will be working through industry research, participate in ongoing education, and apply practical experience while working along the path of becoming a leading subject matter expert in digital workflow and user behavior via security minded data analyst.
* Work closely with Global Information Security department management to provide requirements, offer input, and track progress on infrastructure and engineering work streams
* Working collaboratively with cross-functional teams consisting of: Executives, Software Developers, System Engineers, System Administrators and Site Reliability Engineers to create strategies around Knowledge Discovery / Data Mining.
* Apply statistical and modeling skills to enhance the understanding of our application and workflow data.
* Conduct hands-on research, business intelligence analysis and data mining on large, complex data sets to support the business.
* Collaborate and Ideate on building predictive models and algorithms to optimize software tools and data visualization solutions.
* Create and optimize data visualization models that enable us to target specific: business, financial, operational and technology needs.
* Analyzing the performance of applications, systems, processes in order to provide data and feedback tied to optimizations and refinements.
* Examining other ways to expand the use of data science for improved decision support.
* Help improve business decision support solutions by leveraging internal and external datasets.
* Contribute in technical discussions on data standards and tooling.

Skills & Requirements
* Minimum 5 Years of work experience in data analytics, standards, tooling on large complex data sets and predictive models leveraging algorithms for optimal solutions.
* Excellent understanding of statistics and the ability to confidently translate statistical analyses into compelling and actionable recommendations.
* Strong experience with Excel and writing SQL to extract and manipulate data at the source

* Excel
* R and ggplot2
* Tableau
* Jupyter

Why Hays?

Title: Backend Engineer at Apex Systems
Description:
Job Description

Job #:  1023332
One of our technology clients is looking for a Backend Engineer to join one of their largest and most innovated team in San Francisco or Palo Alto. Their team partners with a variety of functions across hardware, marketing, product, design, and data science. They need engineers with backend expertise to build integrations with our marketing team's platforms to power strategic communications for micromobility users around the world. This collaboration will be one of the biggest growth levers for thier team as we continue to expand our micromobility offerings across the globe.

What You'll Need

- Familiarity with Golang, Python, or Java
- Familiarity working with microservice architectures
- Experience partnering with product and/or marketing to translate business needs into technical requirements
- A willingness to learn how their internal systems fit together
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
EEO Employer

Title: Machine Learning Engineer II from Catapult Solutions Group
Description:
Purpose Of Position: Creates and integrates Machine Learning models and data insights to continuous improve the Company's processes and applications.



To fulfill this position successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily.



Essential Functions:

  • Builds, deploys, monitors, and continuously optimizes ML models and developing automated ML models' training and inference pipelines.
  • Builds a deep understanding of the Company's products, services, data and customers to facilitate development of personalized and fulfilling experience.
  • Dives into machine learning engineering and researching topics including ML algorithms, feature engineering, analysis, modeling, and production deployment.
  • Works with other machine engineering leads to continue to mature the use of machine learning within the organization.
  • Develops training and cross-validation data sets for machine learning algorithms.
  • Translates product management, engineering and business contraints and queries into tractable data science questions.
  • Identifies new opportunities of applying ML technology to improve the business workflows and processes.
  • Performs other related duties and projects as business needs require at direction of management.

The preceding functions have been provided as examples of the type of work performed by employees assigned to this job classification. Management reserves the right to add, subtract, or change the job functions.

Minimum Qualifications: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and ability necessary to successfully perform the essential functions of the position.



Education and Experience:

  • Master's degree in Machine Learning, Deep Learning or a computer science-related field. PhD preferred.
  • Minimum three (3) years of relevant work experience in the areas below, or any equivalent education and/or experience from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been demonstrated/achieved:
    • Understands fundamental concepts, practices and procedures of ML field.

o Data discovery, data aggregation and feature engineering with excellent SQL query writing skills.

o Training, evaluating, optimizing, deploying and maintaining machine learning models on production systems.

o Logging, tracking, A/B testing, evaluate and analysis the performance of different ML algorithms and models on production systems.

o Application developing and strong development skills in Python programming language and have experience on developing data-driven, scalable and reliable applications with AWS.

o Applying machine learning algorithms to solve a wide range of optimization problems like customer sales prediction, recommendation engine, sentiment analysis, deep learning with image and natural language, customer segmentations/clustering, object detection.

o Utilization of popular open source ML/Deep learning libraries like MxNet/Gluon, Tensorflow, scikit-learn, pandas, pyTorch, Keras, xgboost, LightGBM, Turi Create and Nvidia Digits.

o Experience working with relational, non-relational, and high-scale data processing and storage frameworks like SQL, AWS RedShift, Aurora, S3, DynamoDB, MySQL, PostgreSQL.

o Experience with AWS Serverless architecture and AWS native services like EC2, Lambda, Step Functions, SageMaker, DeepLens, Rekognition, IoT, GreenGrass, Comprehend, Lex/Polly and Transcribe.

Special Requirements/Certification:

§ Foundational AWS certification required.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • General knowledge of general office procedures.
  • General knowledge with Agile Scrum development methodologies.
  • Advanced skills in the MS Office suite (Excel, Word, and Outlook).
  • Demonstrated ability to maintain organized reports.
  • Demonstrated reliability, dependability and flexibility in work habits.
  • Demonstrated attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Demonstrated strong analytic and problem solving skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to learn new skills quickly and independently.
  • Ability to prioritize and organize project tasks and goals effectively.
  • Ability to create and compose professionally written documents.
  • Ability to work with various Supervisors and project owners to ensure project goals are met.

§ Ability to read technical diagrams, graphs, and instructions.

§ Ability to read and interpret data and spreadsheets.

Title: Senior Oracle Business Intelligence Analyst  + up to a 5% Signing Reward at Advantex
Description:
JOB OVERVIEW

A Carlsbad based service company is looking for a Senior Oracle Business Intelligence Analyst to join their team. Pay for the Senior Oracle Business Intelligence Analyst is up to $135,000 with generous benefits. This role will require some to go in the office every day if they live in Southern California or Manhattan if they live in New York.


The Business Intelligence team is responsible for the build and support of the company global data warehouse. The team is a fundamental part of the company effort to become a fully digitalized company within the next five years. The team partners with various business units to enable the services required to deliver software, data and business intelligence services.

The team is looking to add an experienced Senior Oracle Business Intelligence Analyst to design, develop and support the company Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise environment. He/she will be part of a global team of Business/Data Analysts, Data Scientists and Application Developers. The individual will have the opportunity to develop his/her technical knowledge and skills while ensuring the applications we build are meeting the highest standards of quality and supportability.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Support of 150+ dashboards, 30 subject areas and numerous scheduled and ad-hoc reports
  • Design and develop business schemas and data models to drive creation of business reports, dashboards, and analyses
  • Gather end-to-end dashboard requirements including logical data model, data sources, security needs, metadata, and preferred visualizations
  • Translate business and functional requirements into detailed technical requirements used to document and develop solutions
  • Diagnose and resolve customer reporting issues
  • Monitor performance, accuracy, and usage of data and reports
  • Automation, deployment, scheduling & distribution of reports
  • BI platform support & administration
  • Auditing source to warehouse process; and curing data errors due to ETL
  • Collaborating with project and business resources on all levels of testing
  • Write SQL scripts, stored procedures, functions and views to prototype new datasets
  • Other duties as assigned


TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES (Knowledge, Skills & Abilities)

  • Solid understanding of dimensional model (Star Schema & Snowflake Schema)
  • OBIEE development experience, report development and metadata repository configuration
  • Experience in core OBIEE applications dashboards, and repository maintenance
  • Experience using Business Intelligence (BI) Publisher with BI applications
  • Experience implementing, supporting, and maintaining Oracle BI applications
  • Proficient in BI Desktop Tools
  • Proficient in BI 11g Publisher
  • Proficient in BI 11g Analytics
  • Proficient in BI 11g database SQL language
  • Proficient in Python and R
  • Experience in debugging and optimizing SQL queries
  • Should have a good understanding of ETL concepts
  • Strong communication, influencing and leadership skills
  • Excellent verbal and writing skills
  • Ability to display supportive behavior and communicate positively regarding department goals and objectives
  • Ability to deal effectively with a variety of personalities to establish and maintain effective working relationships


EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field. Master’s degree preferred.
  • 8 years of progressive industry experience in the field of database design, data architecture and business intelligence or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • OBIEE Design and Deployment: 5 years
  • Oracle Business Intelligence Dashboards, Reporting Design and Development: 5 years
  • Experience with Oracle Database: 5 years

Writing SQL queries to perform complex data analysis: 5 years

Title: Software Engineer 2 - Java Back-End at Intuit
Description:
Imagine a career where your creative inspiration can fuel BIG innovation. Year-over-year, Intuit has been recognized as a best employer and is consistently ranked on Fortune’s “100 Best Companies To Work For” and Fortune World’s “Most Admired Software Companies” lists. Immerse yourself in our award winning culture while creating breakthrough solutions that simplify the lives of consumers and small businesses and their customers worldwide. Intuit is expanding its social, mobile, and global footprint with a full suite of products and services that are revolutionizing the industry. 

Intuit’s Technology Platform group creates the platform for Customer 360 profile. This platform fuels the personalization, marketing and data science efforts across the organization.

Title: Remote Epidemiology Database Administrator at Simulstat
Description:
Description:		The DBA is responsible for the development and implementation of optimal solutions to transform, integrate, store, secure, process and update large real-world healthcare data assets for use by statistical programmers, data scientists and other data analysts.

Relevant database administration experience includes:

•    Extensive knowledge of developing data pipelines using real-world healthcare data including claims and electronic medical records.
•    Experience with one or more of the following commercial databases: MarketScan, Optum, DRG, Flatiron, JMDC, CPRD.
•    Experience with the OMOP data model and optimization of healthcare data for observational research or epidemiology analysis use cases.
•    Familiarity with medical coding, such as ICD-9, ICD-10, LOINC, NDC, CPT/HCPCS, SNOMED. 
•    Familiarity with big data processing platforms including Hadoop, AWS S3 and Databricks.
•    Experience with enterprise support models for data management, security, database programming, service delivery, performance monitoring, and user support standards.
•    Experience with conversion of raw data in ASCII or other formats into OMOP, Parquet or others, and storage in HDFS or S3.
•    Troubleshooting data errors and developing mitigation plans.
•    Strong communication skills for describing issues with data and potential remedies. 

Candidates must have excellent SAS programming skills and the ability to implement complex data step logic. Alternatively, the candidate will be highly proficient with Python or SQL and is able to implement and troubleshoot complex ETL and QC programs.

Strong documentation, communication, and time management skills are essential. 

Experience with database tuning techniques such as normalization, indexing, and parallel processing technologies is desirable as is experience with scripting languages such as Unix shell scripts and PERL.

Additional responsibilities include the following:

•    Ensuring data are consistent across the database
•    Minimizing redundancy across the database
•    Checking variable values for reasonableness
•    Develop database tools to improve database efficiency and utility
•    Building data pipelines for access to research data
•    Managing vendor relations and communication

Basic Qualifications:
•    Bachelor’s degree in in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Life Sciences or other relevant scientific subject.
•    Minimum four (4) years relevant data asset curation experience (description above)
•    Training or experience using the OMOP common data model
•    Experience with real world healthcare data, such as MarketScan, Optum, PharMetrics, Medicare and/or EMR databases

Preferred Qualifications:
•    Masters degree in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Computer Science, or other subject with high statistical content
•    Eight (8) or more years relevant data asset curation experience (description above)
•    Experience in a regulated environment
•    Vendor relations management
•    Pharmaceutical industry experience
•    Experience with ETL software, specifically SnapLogic
•    Training or experience with the Hadoop database platform and Impala or Hive SQL
•    Experience in software development & design life cycle, ideally using Agile methodology

Knowledge:
•    Computer programming with SAS, R, Python or other procedural languages
•    Database transformation, testing, cleaning and quality control using SQL
•    Understanding of computer operating systems, including cloud-based Databricks and UNIX
•    Software development and design

Key Competencies:
•    Technical excellence
•    Innovation
•    Teamwork
•    Problem solving
•    Attention to detail
•    Oral and written communication
